Header: Devastating floods continue in Russia’s Irkutsk region
Content: At least five people have been killed and two are missing following severe floods in Russia’s Irkutsk region in southern Siberia. Over 1160 people were evacuated to safety by Russian emergency services. A cyclone struck the south Siberian region adding rain torrents to local rivers, already filled to the brim with spring-water coming from the mountains. President Vladimir Putin visited the disaster area on Saturday after the G20 summit in Osaka, and urged the emergency and infrastructure officials to speed up their work. 800 million roubles worth of damage was caused to local roads, and agricultural losses were estimated to be 300 million roubles.
